plugins.name: Joy UI Theme Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports a Joy UI theme palette by parsing the Figma variables and comparing to the default Joy UI theme. It will result in a theme object that can be copied and pasted into your code as is, and your code theme will match your Figma theme, eliminating the need for manual updating of theme values in your code.


Coming soon: Github integration to open PR's into your design system with theme changes, with the click of a button!
plugins.tagline: Export Joy UI theme with one click

Perfect for soft UI, dreamy layouts, and colorful moodboards.

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ”Generate Keywords” and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I’d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

105664.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: Convert to ICO
plugins.description:
Convert to Ico is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin that helps designers and developers easily transform any Figma element into Windows ICO icon files.


Key Features:

• Convert any Frame, Group, or Image to ICO format

• Multiple preset size options (16px, 32px, 48px, 64px, 128px)

• Real-time preview functionality

• Clean and intuitive interface

• Quick one-click export


Whether you're designing Windows application icons, website favicons, or working on any project that requires ICO format, Convert to Ico streamlines your workflow with its efficient conversion process.

plugins.name: Airtable Connect
plugins.description:
The plugin allows data from Airtable to be mapped to the layers of Figma components. This functionality is especially useful for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maximize efficiency. With this plugin, it is possible to generate multiple design variations in a matter of seconds, eliminating the need for manual adjustments one by one.


By integrating Airtable with Figma, designers can import structured data directly into their design files. For example, if you have a table in Airtable with different content versions for a marketing campaign, you can assign this data to text and image elements in your Figma components. This not only saves time but also reduces the risk of errors when copying and pasting information.


Furthermore, the plugin is highly versatile and can be used in a variety of projects, from creating user interface prototypes to generating personalized graphic material. Its intuitive use does not require advanced knowledge, making it accessible to both beginner and experienced designers.


In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.


https://airtable-connect.livingcrowdland.com/
plugins.tagline: The plugin maps Airtable data to Figma layers, enabling quick creation of multiple design variations

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
plugins.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Color AutoUpdater
plugins.description:
🚀 Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


✨ What it does:


🔍 Scans all frames on the current page for text nodes with valid hex color codes.

🎨 Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

🌓 Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

🧼 Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


🛠️ How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


⚠️ Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

💡 With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! 🌟
plugins.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

plugins.name: Airsync - Sync from Airtable to Figma
plugins.description:
Airsync access is invite-only and is restricted to select users approved by Tekion.


Airsync connects your Figma project to Airtable, simplifying the process of making content changes. It’s primarily made for product stakeholders, reducing time and effort required to make content alterations in Figma.


Directly edit text or change images in an Airtable base, and the changes will automatically reflect in the linked Figma project. It’s straightforward and practical, designed to enhance the workflow and minimize manual work.


For any suggestions or feedback, please reach out to Shaan Shivanandan.

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome 🙏


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi
plugins.tagline: Images to pixel effect

plugins.name: Variables to Xcode

3. Click the export button.

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


🔥 Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


🚀 How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


🚧 Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


🎁 Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


🤝 License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


💎 Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

92441.name: Tuned Variables

  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection

92441.release_notes:

92441.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: Utopia Spacers
plugins.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.


How to Use

  1. Visit Utopia.fyi and create a system of spacers using their fluid space calculator linked above.
  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.

plugins.name: MarkCraft
plugins.description:
As tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and other AI chats become an everyday part of our creative workflow, we’re constantly generating content in Markdown — ideas, research, notes, and UI copy. But bringing that content into Figma usually means losing all formatting. MarkCraft bridges that gap, turning raw Markdown into beautifully styled, editable text — so your insights look as good as your designs.


Headings, bold, italics, and lists are automatically applied using Figma’s native text features — no manual styling needed. Craft better content inside Figma — with just one click.


⚡ Key Features

Easy Edit

Convert Markdown into fully formatted Figma text — and keep editing like any native text layer.


Smart Lists

Supports clean bulleted and numbered lists (single-level only for V1).


Text Styling

Automatically applies headings, bold, italic — directly into Figma’s text nodes.


Auto Layout Friendly

Generates tidy, responsive frames ready for layout and resizing.
plugins.tagline: Markdown to Figma Made Effortless

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

130782.name: Cloudinary
130782.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... 😆


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

73036.name: Scaffolder
73036.description:

Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.

Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
73036.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

plugins.name: ChromaCraft
plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
plugins.tagline: ColorShift: Enhance with Dynamic Color Combinations

63279.name: ChromaCraft
63279.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.
63279.tagline: ColorShift: Enhance with Dynamic Color Combinations

92807.tagline: Convert Figma variables to CSS/TypeScript and push seamlessly to Bitbucket

plugins.name: TypeGrid
plugins.description:
TypeGrid allows you to:

  1. Generate a typescale: Choose your base font size, ratio, and number of steps, and the plugin instantly creates a preview of your typescale.
  2. Apply a baseline grid: Set your baseline unit and rounding mode, and the plugin ensures your text layers align perfectly to the grid.
  3. Create text layers: With a single click, generate text layers for each step in your typescale, automatically named and styled.
  4. Create text styles: Generate Figma text styles for each step in your typescale, making it easy to apply consistent typography throughout your design.
  5. Preview with custom fonts: See how your typescale looks with any font installed on your system, including different weights.
  6. Fine-tune your settings: Adjust your typescale and baseline grid settings in real-time to get the perfect look for your design.
  7. Save time and ensure consistency: Automate the tedious process of creating and managing typescales and baseline grids, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your designs.
plugins.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

136620.release_notes:
- fixed theming
- fixed inputs
- added italic in preview
- added Inter as default typeface
- small fixes
136620.tagline: Streamline typography with typescale previews, text styles, and a consistent baseline grid.

plugins.name: Figscreen - Screenshot Websites
plugins.description:
Figscreen – Website Screenshots in Figma


Figscreen is a Figma plugin that lets you import website screenshots directly into your canvas. It’s a tool built to simplify the process of collecting and organizing web references.


Features

  1. Bulk Import: Capture up to 25 websites at once
  2. High-Quality Screenshots: Supports Retina resolution
  3. Custom Sizes: Choose from preset device sizes or set custom dimensions (320px to 1920px)
  4. Auto Layout: Screenshots are arranged and labelled on the canvas
  5. Full-Page Support: Captures entire web pages, including lazy-loaded sections
  6. Responsive Views: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile layouts


How to Use

  1. Paste one or more URLs (must include “https://”)
  2. Choose device types or set custom dimensions
  3. Click “Import Screenshots”
  4. Screenshots will appear on your canvas, organized and ready to use


Notes

  1. Works with public websites (no login required)
  2. Captures full pages, including dynamic content
  3. Upcoming features: option to hide banners, pop-ups, and chat widgets


If you have any questions, contact: support@figscreen.com

Found a bug? Report it here: figscreen.com/feedback
plugins.tagline: Capture, Import, Display – Up to 25 Sites at Once

  5. Full-Page Support: Captures entire web pages, including lazy-loaded sections

How to Use

Notes

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin requires access to a local development server to generate and retrieve screenshots of websites.

132883.tagline: Capture, Import, Display – Up to 25 Sites at Once

plugins.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components
plugins.description:
介绍

“暗色组件助手”插件旨在简化在 Figma 组件中管理暗黑模式的过程。通过几次点击，你可以快速启用任何选中组件或实例的暗黑模式，同时如果可用，插件会应用组件库中的暗色 token 设置。


功能说明

  1. 自动检测并启用选中组件和实例的暗黑模式。
  2. 递归检查并更新嵌套在组和框架中的所有组件的暗黑模式。
  3. 允许你将组件库中的“暗色” token 应用于外观模块。
  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  1. 选中你希望应用暗黑模式的组件、组或框架。
  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  1. 插件最佳工作效果是在具有属性定义的组件库中使用。
  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Dark Mode Assistant for Components: Easily Toggle Dark Mode
